page.title: 12Education
page.content: Two primary schools cater for the education of English speaking children. Welsh speaking children attend a Welsh school in Pontardawe. Alltwen Primary, built in 1903 has 230 children on roll. The main building has 7 classrooms with 2 demountables in the yard - one being used as a nursery. The staff consists of a headmistress, nine teachers, 8 female and 1 male, a cook, 6 part-time helpers, 2 supernumary assistants, 2 cleaners, 1 female caretaker, a part-time clerk and 2 nursery nurses. Rhos Primary consists of old and new buildings. With 226 children on roll, the Juniors are educated in the old building built in 1908 whilst the Infants and Nursery are in a new building. The staff consists of a headmaster, 1 male teacher & 7 female, nursery assist. & 8 other staff.
